intro: Chenopodium pratericola, commonly known as prairie goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. This species typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairie and roadside habitats. Its leaves are usually oval or rhombic in shape, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Chenopodium pratericola is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environments.
